name: Greek Chicken Gyros
description: Recreate a Greek, takeout experience at home! No need to wait for the delivery guy or brave the restaurant lines—you don't even need a fancy rotisserie setup. We’ve got an oven hack up our sleeves. (Don’t worry, we’ve got a Tip for the traditionalists, too!) This recipe makes a generous batch of chicken so it’s a two-for-one deal—you’ll have enough for dinner, and then lunch the next day, too.

ingredients.name: Chicken Souvlaki Seasoning or Donair Seasoning

preparation: In a large bowl, toss chicken with seasoning and yogurt. Cover; marinade at least 2 hrs or overnight.
Preheat oven to 400° F. Place Rectangular Steamer on 1⁄4 Sheet Pan. Layer chicken into steamer, one at a time, pressing each thigh down to fill the steamer. Discard excess marinade.
Cover and bake 40 min, or until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165° F.
Meanwhile, dice cucumber, tomato, and onion. In a medium bowl, toss veggies with oil.
Wrap pitas in a clean cloth and microwave on high 30 sec to warm. Divide chicken and veggies between pitas. Top with feta and tzatziki.
tips: Looking for a more traditional version of a gyro? Slice a large white onion in half and lay the flat side down onto an unlined Sheet Pan. Stick two wooden skewers into the onion sticking up. Thread uncooked, marinated chicken onto the skewers over top of the onion. Roast in a preheated 450° F oven for 55 min, or until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165° F. Some charring on the outside is welcome!

products.name: Chicken Souvlaki Seasoning (Pkg of 3)
summary: A Greek-inspired meal, souvlaki is marinated meat grilled on a skewer, often served with warm pita bread and tzatziki. No grill? No problem. Skip the skewers and put your Sheet Pan to work to make equally tasty Chicken Souvlaki in 20 minutes in the oven.

products.name: Donair Seasoning (Pack of 3)
summary: Any way you name it – gyro, shawarma, donair, or doner kebab – our Donair Seasoning is what you’re looking for. You won’t believe how easy it is to make the street food staple at home in minutes with this blend and a few simple ingredients. Just add the seasoning to ground beef, press it into a Rectangular Steamer and cook it in the microwave for 10 minutes or the oven for 60. Slice thinly and serve on a pita with fresh veggies and tzatziki – dinner is done!

products.name: Lemon Dilly Dip Mix
summary: Beyond being one of our most-loved kid-friendly dips – they love it for dunking chicken strips, fish bites, and veggies – Lemon Dilly is all about versatility. With loads of dill and a hint of lemon zest, it makes an utterly delicious tzatziki and spread for burgers and sandwiches, and levels up everything from salad dressing and salmon to pasta and vegetables.
